summary:
Mozambique is a country in southeast Africa with a rich history. It was once home to Swahili port towns and later colonized by the Portuguese. After gaining independence in 1975, it faced a civil war but has since become a stable republic.

The country has a diverse population, mainly Bantu people, and many languages, with Portuguese as the official one. Christianity is the dominant religion. Mozambique is known for its natural resources, agriculture, and growing tourism. Despite economic growth, it remains one of the world's poorest nations. It is a member of various international organizations, including the United Nations and the African Union.
title: Mozambique
